titles.title: OPIC Amendments Act of 1994
A bill to extend the authorities of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation through fiscal year 1995, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 617.

action.text: Senate incorporated this measure in H.R. 4950 as an amendment.
Senate passed companion measure H.R. 4950 in lieu of this measure by Voice Vote.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 9/19/1994--Introduced. OPIC Amendments Act of 1994 - Amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to raise the ceilings on the maximum contingent liabilities outstanding at any one time for investment insurance and investment guaranties issued by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC). Extends OPIC's authority to issue such insurance and guaranties through FY 1995.
